fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.http

Interface IHttpAttributes


  • public interface IHttpAttributes
    Provides access to session and call (request) attributes for an HTTP call.

    Session attribute values (other than instances of String and primitive types) must be Serializable, to enable persistent storage and distributed deployment. Such values can only be deserialized if the context classloader can instantiate the actual implementation, or if a suitable classloader can be provided.

    Thread-safety: implementations of this interface are not required to be safe for concurrent access. Therefore, processing should generally not be shared between multiple threads.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IHttpServiceCall.getAttributes()

    • Field Detail

      • CGI_REMOTE_ADDR

        static final String CGI_REMOTE_ADDR
        Defines the CGI REMOTE_ADDR variable name.

        This can be used to query the client (or proxy) IP address as an instance of InetAddress (IPv4 or IPv6). The accuracy and usefulness of this information will vary according to your network configuration.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getCallAttributeAs(String, Class), Constant Field Values

      • KEY_SESSION_CREATED

        static final String KEY_SESSION_CREATED
        Gets the key for an immutable session attribute containing a session creation timestamp. This key is not returned by getSessionAttributeNames().

        The value is an instance of Long, corresponding to a Unix timestamp. This value is created automatically when a session is created, and cannot be modified or removed from the session.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getSessionCreationTime()

      • KEY_SESSION_ID_ENCODING

        static final String KEY_SESSION_ID_ENCODING
        Gets the key for an optional call attribute that may be set as a hint for methods and functions that produce links or redirect URLs to encode the session ID, when a session exists, even when cookies are enabled.

        The value is expected to be an instance of Boolean, which should be applied by such methods and functions when specified on a per-call basis.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        putCallAttribute(String, Object)

    • Method Detail

      • getSessionCreationTime

        long getSessionCreationTime()
        Gets the time at which the current session, if any, was created.
        Returns:
        the session creation time, as a number of milliseconds since the Unix epoch, or 0 if there is no active session available. Note that the time is rounded down to the nearest second, for easier interoperability with HTTP headers, which are only precise to the nearest second.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        hasSession(), requireSession(), IHttpServiceCall.getIfModifiedSince(), IHttpServiceCall.setLastModified(long)

      • hasSession

        boolean hasSession()
        Indicates whether a session was required and made available. No session is created if no session exists.
        Returns:
        true if a session exists, otherwise false. Always returns false if requireSession() has not been called yet.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getSessionCreationTime(), requireSession()

      • requireSession

        String requireSession()
        Creates a session, or retrieves an existing session, returning the session's identifying string.

        When required, this should be called before response headers are committed, as it will be too late too add a session cookie (if using URL rewriting, this is less important unless some URLs have already been written without including the session ID).

        Returns:
        the session ID, or null if no session exists and no session could be created (for example, after destroying the session).
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        hasSession(), replaceSession(), destroySession()

      • replaceSession

        String replaceSession()
        Replaces the current session (if any) with a new session, or creates a new session (if none), returning the new session's identifying string. Attributes associated with the replaced (old) session are copied into the new session.

        Authentication protocols should use this method to protect against session fixation attacks, when validating user credentials.

        When required, this should be called before response headers are committed, as it will be too late too add a session cookie (if using URL rewriting, this is less important unless some URLs have already been written without including the session ID).

        Returns:
        the session ID, or null if no new session could be created (for example, after destroying the session).
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        requireSession(), destroySession()

      • destroySession

        void destroySession()
        Destroys a session, invalidating further usage.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        hasSession(), requireSession(), replaceSession()

      • getMaxInactiveInterval

        int getMaxInactiveInterval()
        Gets the maximum inactive interval, as a number of seconds.
        Returns:
        the maximum inactive interval. A negative value indicates that the session should never expire.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no session exists.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        hasSession(), requireSession()

      • setMaxInactiveInterval

        void setMaxInactiveInterval(int intervalInSeconds)
        Sets the maximum inactive interval, as a number of seconds.

        If necessary, a session will be created implicitly, unless the session has already been explicitly destroyed.

        Parameters:
        intervalInSeconds - the maximum inactive interval, as a number of seconds. Setting this to a negative value indicates that the session should never expire. A value of 0 will be coerced to 1.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        hasSession(), requireSession(), destroySession()

      • getSessionId

        String getSessionId()
        Gets the session ID string.
        Returns:
        the session ID, or null if there is no session.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no session exists.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IHttpServiceCall.encodeUrl(CharSequence), hasSession(), requireSession()

      • getSessionAttributeNames

        List<String> getSessionAttributeNames()
        Gets a list of all current session attribute names.
        Returns:
        a list containing zero, one, or more elements. Never null.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no session exists.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        hasSession(), requireSession()

      • getSessionAttribute

        Object getSessionAttribute(String attributeName)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException,
                           IllegalStateException,
                           UnsupportedOperationException
        Gets a named session attribute.

        Note: when using Serializable attributes, if any changes are made to such objects after being returned by this method, you must put the updated object back into the session (with appropriate concurrency controls, for consistency with regards to concurrent requests), in order for such changes to be persisted in the session.

        All non-primitive attribute values are serialized by default when stored as session attributes. The actual type of the attribute value (not just its interface types), and all referenced types, must be visible to the context class loader, or deserialization will fail.

        Parameters:
        attributeName - the name of the attribute.
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute. Returns null if the attribute is undefined.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the attribute name is null.
        IllegalStateException - if no session exists.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if deserialization fails for the current classloader context.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        hasSession(), requireSession()

      • getSessionAttributeAs

        <T> T getSessionAttributeAs(String attributeName,
                            Class<T> asType)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException,
                            IllegalStateException,
                            UnsupportedOperationException
        Gets a named session attribute, if defined and if the value can be deserialized and then cast to the specified type.

        Note: when using Serializable attributes, if any changes are made to such objects after being returned by this method, you must put the updated object back into the session (with appropriate concurrency controls, for consistency with regards to concurrent requests), in order for such changes to be persisted in the session.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the required type.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - the name of the attribute.
        asType - non-null class or interface type. For serialized non-primitive values (other than String, the specified type's classloader must be able to deserialize the value.
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute. Returns null if the attribute is undefined or deserialized as a different type.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the attribute name or type are null.
        IllegalStateException - if no session exists.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if deserialization fails for the current classloader context.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        hasSession(), requireSession()

      • getSessionAttributeAs

        <T> T getSessionAttributeAs(String attributeName,
                            Class<T> asType,
                            Supplier<ClassLoader> definer)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException,
                            IllegalStateException,
                            UnsupportedOperationException
        Gets a named session attribute, if defined and if the value can be deserialized using a supplied classloader, and then cast to the specified type.

        Note: when using Serializable attributes, if any changes are made to such objects after being returned by this method, you must put the updated object back into the session (with appropriate concurrency controls, for consistency with regards to concurrent requests), in order for such changes to be persisted in the session.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the required type.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - the name of the attribute.
        asType - non-null class or interface type.
        definer - non-null supplier of the non-null classloader to use, to deserialize non-primitive values.
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute. Returns null if the attribute is undefined or deserialized as a different type.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the attribute name or type are null.
        IllegalStateException - if no session exists.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if deserialization fails for the current classloader context.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        hasSession(), requireSession()

      • removeSessionAttribute

        Object removeSessionAttribute(String attributeName)
        Removes a named session attribute.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - the name of the attribute.
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute, if it was defined.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no session exists.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        hasSession(), requireSession()

      • putSessionAttribute

        void putSessionAttribute(String attributeName,
                         Object value)
                  throws IOException
        Sets the value of a named session attribute.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - the name of the attribute which must not be null or an empty string.
        value - the value of the attribute. If null, this is the same as calling removeSessionAttribute(String). By default, attribute values must implement the Serializable interface.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no session exists.
        IOException - if a serializable value is required but not provided, or if any other I/O error occurs when persisting the attribute.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        hasSession(), requireSession()

        List<String> getCallAttributeNames()
        Gets a list of all current call (request) attribute names.
        Returns:
        a list containing zero, one, or more elements. Never null.
        Since:
        1.0

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the value of the attribute. Returns null if the attribute is undefined.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getCallAttributeAs

        <T> T getCallAttributeAs(String attributeName,
                         Class<T> asType)
        Gets a named call (request) attribute, if defined and if the value can be cast to the specified type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the required type.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - the name of the attribute.
        asType - non-null class.
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute. Returns null if the attribute is undefined.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the attribute name or type are null.
        Since:
        1.0

        Removes a named call (request) attribute.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - the name of the attribute.
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute, if it was defined.
        Since:
        1.0

      • putCallAttribute

        void putCallAttribute(String attributeName,
                      Object value)
        Sets the value of a named call (request) attribute.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - the name of the attribute.
        value - the value of the attribute. If null, this is the same as calling removeCallAttribute(String).
        Since:
        1.0

      • addAuthnService

        void addAuthnService(IAuthnService authenticationService)
        Registers an authentication service that has successfully authenticated a user for this call, to provide access to the authenticated user when required in subsequent processing. If there is a related authorization service, this should be registered at the same time.

        Generally, this registration is performed by an implementation of IFilteringService.

        There is normally no need to register the service if no user was authenticated. The registration remains effective for the duration of the call.

        Parameters:
        authenticationService - the non-null authentication service to register.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IHttpServiceCall.getAuthnServices(), addAuthzService(fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.auth.IAuthzService)

      • addAuthzService

        void addAuthzService(IAuthzService authorizationService)
        Registers an authorization service for this call, to check permissions for the current user when required in subsequent processing.

        Generally, this registration is performed by an implementation of IFilteringService after authenticating a user.

        There is normally no need to register the service if no user was authenticated. The registration remains effective for the duration of the call.

        Parameters:
        authorizationService - the non-null authorization service to register.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IHttpServiceCall.getAuthzServices(), addAuthnService(fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.auth.IAuthnService)
